getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: Welcome to the ultimate guide for JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and React Native development! Whether you're building dynamic web apps or cross-platform mobile applications, this documentation has you covered with clear, practical resources.

Javascript/Beginner/arrays.title: Arrays
Javascript/Beginner/arrays.description: Hey, code rockstar! üé∏ You've got functions nailed, so now let‚Äôs dive into arrays‚Äîyour go-to tool for storing lists of stuff. T#### What's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/control-structures.title: Control Structures
Javascript/Beginner/control-structures.description: Whoa, code adventurer! üß≠ You've mastered operators, so now let's give your programs a brain‚Äîcontrol structures! These are like choose-your-own-adventure books for code: they let your script make decisions based on conditions. No more straight-line code; now it can branch out, skip parts, or choose paths.

Javascript/Beginner/functions.title: Functions
Javascript/Beginner/functions.description: Hey, code ninja! ü•∑ You're looping like a champ‚Äînow let's talk functions, the superheroes of reusable code. Functions let you bu#### WFunctions are your code's superpowers‚Äîreusable and awesome! Next, we'll tackle arrays to store lists of data. Dash to Arrays to keep rocking it. You're coding like a pro‚Äîkeep shining! üí•at's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/introduction-to-java.title: JavaScript Basics
Javascript/Beginner/introduction-to-java.description: Hey there, future coder! üöÄ Welcome to the magical world of JavaScript (often just called JS). If you're new to programming, don't worry‚Äîwe're starting from the very beginning. Think of JavaScript as the secret sauce that makes websites come alive: buttons that respond when you click them, forms that check your input, and even games right in your browser.

Javascript/Beginner/loops.title: Loops
Javascript/Beginner/loops.description: Greetings, loop master in training! üîÑ You've got decisions down pat‚Äînow let's add repetition to the mix. Loops are like your code's treadmill: they run the same block over and over until a condition says "stop!" Why? To handle lists, count things, or repeat actions without copying code a zillion times. Imagine printing "Hello" 100 times manually‚Äîboring! Loops make it effortless.

Javascript/Beginner/objects.title: Objects
Javascript/Beginner/objects.description: Hey, coding superstar! üåü You've conquered arrays, and now it‚Äôs time to meet #### WObjects are your data superheroes, organizing everything neatly! You've now got the beginner basics down‚Äîvariables, loops, functions, arrays, and objects. Time to put it all together with some fun projects! Jump to Beginner Projects to build a Digital Dice Roller, Random Joke Generator, and Simple Calculator. You're ready to create‚Äîlet's do this! üéâat's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/operators.title: Operators in JavaScript
Javascript/Beginner/operators.description: Hey, code explorer! üåç You've got variables and data types under your belt‚Äînow it's time to make them dance with operators. Operators are like the tools in your coding toolbox: they let you add, compare, and combine things in fun ways. Think of them as math symbols on steroids, but for all kinds of data.

Javascript/Beginner/projects.title: Fun Beginner Projects
Javascript/Beginner/projects.description: Wow, you‚Äôve made it through the JavaScript basics‚Äîtime to celebrate by building something awesome! üéâ These three mini-projects‚ÄîDigital Dice Roller, Random Joke Generator, and Simple Calculator‚Äîwill put your ski#### WYou've built three awesome projects‚Äîdice, jokes, and math! You're ready for more challenges. Head to Intermediate JavaScript for topics like callbacks, promises, and DOM deep-dives. Or, keep building with more projects in Advanced Projects. You're a coding hero‚Äîkeep it up! ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èat's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/variables-and-dataty.title: Variables and Data Types
Javascript/Beginner/variables-and-dataty.description: Hello again, aspiring JavaScript wizard! üåü If you've made it here from the basics, pat yourself on the back‚Äîyou're already writing code that runs in the browser. Now, let's level up by learning how to store and work with information in JS. Think of this as packing your backpack for a coding adventure: variables are your bags, and data types are the stuff you put inside.

Javascript/Intermediate/advanced-functio.title: Advanced Functions
Javascript/Intermediate/advanced-functio.description: You‚Äôve conquered the basics‚Äîvariables, loops, arrays, objects, and functions‚Äîand now it‚Äôs time to supercharge your functions with some intermediate magic. Functions are the heart of JavaScript, and these advanced techniques will make them more powerful, flexible, and fun to use. Think of this as upgrading your coding toolbox with shiny new gadgets!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: Asynchronous JavaScript
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Hey, time-traveling coder! ‚è∞ You‚Äôve mastered DOM manipulation and ES6+ features‚Äînow it‚Äôs time to conquer asynchronous JavaScript, the magic that lets your code handle tasks that take time, like fetching data, waiting for timers, or responding to user clicks without freezing the page. JavaScript is single-threaded (one task at a time), but async tricks make it feel multitasking!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: JS Asynchronous Operations
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Time to peek behind the curtain! ‚è∞ You've learned about callbacks, but how does JavaScript actually handle asynchronous operations? Let's explore timers, events, and the magical event loop that makes it all work. Understanding this will make you a better async programmer!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: JS Callbacks
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Welcome to the world of callbacks! üìû You've actually used these before in our advanced functions section, but now we're diving deeper into their async superpowers. Callbacks are the OG way to handle tasks that take time‚Äîthey're functions passed to other functions to run when something finishes (or fails).

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: Asynchronous Js
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Hey, time-traveling coder! ‚è∞ You've mastered DOM manipulation and ES6+ features‚Äînow it's time to conquer asynchronous JavaScript, the magic that lets your code handle tasks that take time, like fetching data, waiting for timers, or responding to user clicks without freezing the page. JavaScript is single-threaded (one task at a time), but async tricks make it feel multitasking!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: JS Promises
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Welcome to the Promise land! üåü After wrestling with callback hell, Promises are like a breath of fresh air. They represent a value that might be available now, later, or never. Think of a Promise as a receipt for your coffee order‚Äîit's either fulfilled (coffee ready!), rejected (sorry, we're out!), or still pending (brewing...).

Javascript/Intermediate/dom-manipulation.title: DOM Manipulation
Javascript/Intermediate/dom-manipulation.description: You‚Äôve got functions, arrays, and objects down, and now it‚Äôs time to take control of web pages with DOM manipulation. The Document Object Model (DOM) is like a bridge between your JavaScript code and the HTML/CSS on a page. It turns your webpage into a living, breathing thing you can change on the fly‚Äîthink updating text, styling buttons, or adding new elements with a click.

Javascript/Intermediate/error-handling.title: Error Handling
Javascript/Intermediate/error-handling.description: You‚Äôre fetching data and manipulating the DOM like a champ, but sometimes things go wrong‚Äîinvalid inputs, network failures, or pesky bugs. That‚Äôs where error handling comes in, saving your app from crashing and keeping users happy. Think of it as your code‚Äôs safety net, catching problems before they spiral out of control.

Javascript/Intermediate/es6-features.title: ES6+ Features
Javascript/Intermediate/es6-features.description: You‚Äôre rocking the DOM and advanced functions‚Äînow it‚Äôs time to embrace the sleek, modern vibes of ES6+ (ECMAScript 2015 and later). These features, introduced starting in 2015, make JavaScript more powerful and fun to write. Think of them as upgrades to your coding spaceship: faster, smoother, and packed with cool tricks.

Javascript/Intermediate/final-projects.title: Final Projects
Javascript/Intermediate/final-projects.description: üéâ Congratulations, JavaScript Master! You've conquered variables, functions, DOM manipulation, ES6+, async programming, and error handling. Now it's time to put it all together with some epic final projects that will challenge your skills and build your portfolio!

Javascript/Intermediate/index.title: Intermediate
Javascript/Intermediate/index.description: Welcome back, JavaScript warrior! üöÄ You've conquered the basics‚Äîvariables, functions, loops, and objects. Now it's time to level up with intermediate concepts that will transform you from a beginner into a confident developer ready to build real-world applications.

Javascript/Intermediate/json-apis.title: JSON and APIs
Javascript/Intermediate/json-apis.description: You‚Äôve mastered async JavaScript, so now it‚Äôs time to talk to the world using JSON and APIs. JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is like a universal language for data‚Äîlightweight, readable, and used everywhere from apps to servers. APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) are like doorways to fetch or send that data, letting your app grab jokes, weather, or user info from the internet.
